faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, EU and non-EU citizens can purchase property in Spain. You'll need a NIE number and a Spanish tax identification number. Most foreign buyers engage a Spanish lawyer to ensure compliance with property laws and tax regulations.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Typical costs include transfer tax (6-10%), legal fees (800-1,500 euros), notary fees (400-600 euros), and registration fees. RODA REAL ESTATE can provide guidance on total acquisition costs for RODA RESIDENCES.
